confirm.delete_service: Do you want to delete this service?
confirm.delete_route: Do you want to delete this route?
confirm.delete_upstream: Do you want to delete this upstream?
confirm.delete_consumer: Do you want to delete this consumer?
confirm.delete_target: Do you want to delete this target?
confirm.delete_sni: Do you want to delete this SNI?
confirm.delete_cert: Do you want to delete this certificate? This will also delete the SNIs associated with it
confirm.delete_cacert: Do you want to delete this CA certificate?
confirm.delete_plugin: Do you want to delete this plugin?
confirm.enable_plugin: Do you want to enable this plugin?
confirm.disable_plugin: Do you want to disable this plugin

about.title: About King
about.github: You can find the project in

menu.kong_node_tooltip: Type in the URL and port
menu.error_node_field: Must be a valid url. Format: http(s)://<admin-api>:<port>

landing.title: Type here the address and port of the administration API of a Kong node, and click on the arrow to connect
landing.subtitle: If you have connected with a node previously you will see it in the selector

architect.center_network: Adjust graph to fit all nodes
architect.filter: Filter by tags, separated by commas
architect.filter_element_mainonly: Show only services, routes and upstreams

dialog.name: Name for the Service
dialog.url_hint: Must include protocol, host, port and path if it`s needed
dialog.connect_tooltip: Timeout for connection to the upstream server
dialog.write_tooltip: Timeout between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server
dialog.read_tooltip: Timeout between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server
dialog.certificate_tooltip: Certificate (UUID) to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server
dialog.ca_certificates_tooltip: Array of CA Certificate object UUIDs that are used to build the trust store while verifying upstream server’s TLS certificate. If set to null when Nginx default is respected. If default CA list in Nginx are not specified and TLS verification is enabled, then handshake with upstream server will always fail (because no CA are trusted).
dialog.tls_verify_tooltip: Whether to enable verification of upstream server TLS certificate. If left empty, then the Nginx default is respected.
dialog.tls_verify_depth_tooltip: Maximum depth of chain while verifying Upstream server’s TLS certificate. If left empty, then the Nginx default is respected.
dialog.tags_hint: Write a tag and press enter or comma

error.protocol_path_collision: Selected protocol does not allow any path param, leave it empty

dialog.name: Name for the Route
dialog.protocols_tooltip:
For http, at least one of methods, hosts, headers or paths. Does not allow sources or destinations.
For https, at least one of methods, hosts, headers, paths or snis. Does not allow sources or destinations.
For tcp and udp, at least one of sources or destinations. Does not allow any more.
For tls, at least one of sources, destinations or snis. Does not allow any more.
For grpc, at least one of hosts, headers or paths. Does not allow any more.
For grpcs, at least one of hosts, headers, paths or snis. Does not allow any more.
dialog.hosts_tooltip: A list of hosts that match this Route. Allows one wildcard at the beggining or the end
dialog.hosts_hint: Write a value and press enter or coma
dialog.paths_tooltip: A list of paths that match this Route
dialog.methods_tooltip: A list of HTTP methods that match this Route
dialog.redirect_tooltip: The status code Kong responds with when all properties of a Route match except the protocol i.e. if the protocol of the request is HTTP instead of HTTPS
dialog.regex_tooltip: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using regexes simultaneously
dialog.strip_path_tooltip: When matching a Route via one of the paths, strip the matching prefix from the upstream request URL
dialog.preserve_host_tooltip: When matching a Route via one of the hosts domain names, use the request Host header in the upstream request headers
dialog.snis_tooltip: A list of SNIs that match this Route when using stream routing
dialog.sources_hint: Sources of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing
dialog.destinations_hint: Destinations of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing

error.final_validation: There are fields that must be filled. Read the Protocols field help for more information

dialog.no_upstream: Cannot create a new upstream because there are no service hosts available
dialog.name: Hostname for the Upstream
dialog.name_hint: Choose a host from an existing service
dialog.hash_on_tooltip: What to use as hashing input. Using none results in a weighted-round-robin scheme with no hashing
dialog.hash_fallback_tooltip: What to use as hashing input if the primary hash_on does not return a hash
dialog.hash_on_header_tooltip: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when Hash is set to 'header'
dialog.hash_fallback_header_tooltip: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when Hash fallback is set to 'header'
dialog.hash_on_cookie_tooltip: The cookie name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when Hash or Hash fallback is set to 'cookie'. If the specified cookie is not in the request, Kong will generate a value and set the cookie in the response
dialog.hash_on_cookie_path_tooltip: The cookie path to set in the response headers. Only required when Hash or Hash fallback is set to 'cookie'
dialog.certificate_tooltip: Certificate (UUID) to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server
dialog.host_tooltip: The hostname to be used as Host header when proxying requests through Kong
dialog.slots_tooltip: The number of slots in the loadbalancer algorithm
dialog.https_verify_certificate_tooltip: Whether to check the validity of the SSL certificate of the remote host when performing active health checks using HTTPS
dialog.type_healthcheck_tooltip: Whether to perform health checks using HTTP or HTTPS, or just attempt a TCP connection
dialog.http_path_tooltip: Path to use in GET HTTP request to run as a probe on active health checks
dialog.https_sni: SNI hostname for HTTPS health checks
dialog.https_sni_tooltip: The hostname to use as an SNI (Server Name Identification) when performing active health checks using HTTPS. This is particularly useful when Targets are configured using IPs, so that the target host’s certificate can be verified with the proper SNI
dialog.http_statuses: HTTP statuses to consider target as healthy
dialog.http_statuses_unhealthy: HTTP statuses to consider target as unhealthy
dialog.interval_tooltip: Interval between health checks in seconds (0 to disable checks)
dialog.successes_tooltip: Number of successes in checks to consider a target healthy
dialog.http_failures_tooltip: Number of HTTP failures in active probes to consider a target unhealthy
dialog.tcp_failures_tooltip: Number of TCP failures in active probes to consider a target unhealthy
dialog.timeouts_tooltip: Number of timeouts to consider a target as unhealthy
dialog.threshold: Percentage of targets to consider upstream healthy
dialog.threshold_tooltip: The minimum percentage of the upstream’s targets´ weight that must be available for the whole upstream to be considered healthy

error.header_format: Allowed numbers, uppercase and lowercase characters and - _
error.cookie_format: All characters allowed but comma, semi-colon and white spaces
error.hash_on_form: When selecting 'header' as Hash value, the Hash header field is mandatory
error.hash_fallback_form: When selecting 'header' as Fallback value, the Fallback header field is mandatory
error.hash_cookie_form: When selecting 'cookie' as Hash or Fallback value, the Name and Cookie path fields are mandatory
error.http_statuses: Must be a valid HTTP status code

dialog.custom_id_tooltip: Field for storing an existing unique ID for the Consumer, useful for mapping Kong with users in your existing database

error.final_validation: Must include username or custom ID

dialog.name: Name of the Plugin
dialog.protocols_tooltip: A list of the request protocols that will trigger this plugin
dialog.route_tooltip: If set, the plugin will only activate when receiving requests via the specified route. Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the Route being used
dialog.service_tooltip: If set, the plugin will only activate when receiving requests via one of the routes belonging to the specified Service. Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the Service being matched
dialog.consumer_tooltip: If set, the plugin will activate only for requests where the specified consumer has been authenticated (note that some plugins can not be restricted to consumers this way). Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the authenticated Consumer

target.set_healthy_content: Confirm that you want to set it as healthy.
target.set_unhealthy_content: Confirm that you want to set it as unhealthy.

dialog.create: Create a new Target for the upstream {{up}}
dialog.target_tooltip: The target address (ip or hostname). If the hostname resolves to an SRV record, the port value will be overridden by the value from the DNS record
dialog.weight_tooltip: The weight this target gets within the upstream loadbalancer (0-65535). If the hostname resolves to an SRV record, the weight value will be overridden by the value from the DNS record

dialog.name: Name
dialog.name_tooltip: The SNI name to associate with the given certificate
dialog.certificate_tooltip: The id (a UUID) of the certificate with which to associate the SNI hostname. The Certificate must have a valid private key associated with it to be used by the SNI object
